channel.title: New local problems on FixMyStreet
channel.description: The latest local problems reported by users

item.title: Corner of Gibson Sq, 22nd July
item.description:
Someone has knocked over the metal bollard. The area needs to be made safe and the bollard replaced.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 59, Theberton Street, Islington, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Near 37 & 39 Hartland Rd NW1, 22nd July
item.description:
Someone has smashed in to the bollards here and knocked down the sign post too. They need to be made safe and replaced.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 57, Hartland Road, Chalk Farm, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Overgrown hedge around the base of tree., 22nd July
item.description:
Overgrown hedge around the base of the tree is making the visibility to see pedestrians and oncoming traffic when pulling out of my driveway. Also the tree has become considerably overgrown in general causing a mess from birds dropping on my drive. I’ve just paid to have me washed and sanded yet it’s constantly having to be cleaned through the mess of the tree!

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Frinsted Road, Northumberland Heath, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: In the area at the corner of Southfield Road and Hertford Road, northern kerb two heaps of assorted rubbish., 22nd July
item.description:
This is a disgraceful mess. Rotting debris including duvets and bedding. Lots of wood piled against the back of the shop on the corner of Southfield/Hertford roads. A health hazard and a fire hazard also encouraging further dumping and making Enfield look down at heel and sad.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 1, Southfield Road, Ponders End, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Rubbish bags, 22nd July
item.description:
There are rubbish bags dumped outside the pavement at 32 Brymon court

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 5, Montagu Place, Marylebone, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: This tree is dangerous! Needs urgent attention. Outside 31/33 Southfield Road, 22nd July
item.description:
This tree is almost completely blocking the footway. There is approximately I foot of clear path to walk on between tree and wall. It is impossible to pass with a buggy and hideous for a wheelchair user. Please get this trimmed urgently as people have to walk in the road.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 36, Southfield Road, Ponders End, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.description:

item.title: Mess around the MRC, 22nd July
item.description:
Bulky waste - toilet bowls, TV and other items left by the bins. Other waste scattered around the site, one bin moved from its position. Boston Place MRC

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 106, Boston Place, Marylebone, London

item.title: Really bad issue with the homeless people, 22nd July
item.description:
They sit outside the betting shop and off licence, I don’t feel safe when waking. They take drugs openly, defalcate, steal, litter and are generally aggressive. This situation is out of control.
Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): Mare Street, Hackney, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Tarmac completely disintegrating on pavement, 22nd July
item.description:
This tarmac "patch" has been slowly breaking up over last couple of years. It's now a potential hazard.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Lawley Road, Brunswick Park, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Flytipped rubbish in entrance to garage access Southfield Road near junction with Northfield Road, eastern kerb., 22nd July
item.description:
A pile of rubbish blocking the entry to garages and making the area look unkempt which encourages further dumping and antisocial behaviour. Please clear and remove the road work barriers which have been here for many weeks

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 90, Southfield Road, Ponders End, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Daily repeated dog barking, 22nd July
item.description:
Group of people training an Alsation dog, getting other dogs to bark at it, & people to bait it until it barks, repeatedly on raised deck Brown Hart Gardens, most days between 5.30pm and 8pm. It has been happening for the last few weeks. Barking noise amplifies into residents' homes in surrounding blocks of flats.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): George Yard, Mayfair, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.description:

item.title: Big blue bottle bank bins need emptying, 22nd July
item.description:
Resident reporting the big blue bottle banks for recycling cans & glass are completely full and have been for a number of years there is danger of glass breaking and causing severe injury to all pedestrians using the station by foot. They have not been emptied in over 2 years they have been reported to Industrial waste, trade waste & the Council but nothing seems to be actioned. Please could someone look into this asap and at least find out who is responsible - Resident has sent lots of e-mails -Thanks
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Whitehall Lane, North End, London
Report on FixMyStreet
